column4: just upgradded to dapper and now wireless wont work, using an acx111 card, no encryption, and none of the usual tricks work, ive read network-manager might work but cant install it without a connection, the hardware and driver (ndiswrapper) are recognized but cant find the accespoints
is your card turned on? make sure it is, then run 'sudo ifup <interfacename>' then run 'iwlist scanning' and tell me if u get anything
run iwconfig... should give you specifics about wireless only
just go to packages.ubuntu.com and download network-manager and all dependancies
then move them to the other comp. and use dpkg to install
they should all be on the repos there
u have to install them in certain order
do dpkg -i <package names> (for all the packages)
then when you do this for all, apt-get -f install should fix the configurations
the other deps can probably be resoved by apt-get and CD
apt-get -f install like i said... do it between packages see if it works
best way to do it is after you install everything you have
think i can get away with just network-monitor and its deps, and not the recomended gnome-network-monitor and all its deps too?
you might... but some of the other deps are actually part of the interface
